definition: hesitant and not daring to move forward (idiom)
to falter/unable to move
to hesitate/to mark time
to recline
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: I want you to be happy, not sad.
sentences.chinese: 我要你快樂趑趄不前，不要哀傷。

definition: to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib
to hesitate/indecisive
to trip forwards or stumble back (idiom, from Book of Songs); can't get anything right
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to advance with difficulty/to hesitate to advance
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
to go one's own way (idiom); to act independently without asking others
see 心中無數|心中无数[xin1 zhong1 wu2 shu4]
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to fall down/to fall forward
apprehension/apprehensive
to seem as if something is amiss (idiom)
to advise and encourage
